curam.util.common.domain

Interface Domain

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PlugInContainer<Domain>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClientDomain

    public interface Domain
extends PlugInContainer<Domain>
    A domain and its associated information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • Methods inherited from interface curam.util.common.plugin.PlugInContainer

        getChildren, getName, getParent, getPlugIn

    • Method Detail

      • getRootDomain

        Domain getRootDomain()
        Gets the ultimate ancestor (root) domain of this domain. The ultimate ancestor of any domain should be one of the core infrastructure domains.
        Returns:
        The root domain for this domain.

      • isDescendant

        boolean isDescendant(java.lang.String name)
        Indicates if a domain is a descendant of the named domain or is the same domain.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the possible ancestor domain.
        Returns:
        true if this domain is a descendant or is the same domain as the named domain, false otherwise.

      • isDescendant

        boolean isDescendant(Domain domain)
        Indicates if a domain is a descendant of the given domain or is the same domain.
        Parameters:
        domain - The possible ancestor domain.
        Returns:
        true if this domain is a descendant or is the same domain as the given domain, false otherwise.

      • getPlugIn

        DomainPlugIn getPlugIn(java.lang.String plugInName)
                throws DomainException

        Gets the named plug-in object associated with this domain.

        This method is equivalent to the calling PlugInContainer.getPlugIn(String, curam.util.common.plugin.PlugInTarget) method passing PlugInTarget.SELF as the target. However, for backward compatibility, the return type is DomainPlugIn and the exception type is DomainException. When getting domain plug-ins, use this method in preference to the super-interface method, as this method will throw exceptions with more informative error messages when problems arise.

        Parameters:
        plugInName - The name of the plug-in.
        Returns:
        The plug-in object, may be null.
        Throws:
        DomainException - If the plug-in name is null.

      • getHeritablePlugIn

        DomainPlugIn getHeritablePlugIn(java.lang.String plugInName)
                         throws DomainException

        Gets the named plug-in object associated with descendants of this domain. This is not necessarily the same type of plug-in used by this domain for its own purposes.

        This method is equivalent to the calling PlugInContainer.getPlugIn(String, curam.util.common.plugin.PlugInTarget) method passing PlugInTarget.DESCENDANT as the target. However, for backward compatibility, the return type is DomainPlugIn and the exception type is DomainException. When getting domain plug-ins, use this method in preference to the super-interface method, as this method will throw exceptions with more informative error messages when problems arise.

        Parameters:
        plugInName - The name of the plug-in.
        Returns:
        The plug-in object, may be null.
        Throws:
        DomainException - If the plug-in name is null.
